name: Accessibility and sisus (people with disabilities)
description:
####Accessibility####   
 ​
The Accessibility team is there to help the IST members to plan and prepare the camp.

**During the camp:**  

* The team takes care of the ACCESSIBILITY AND ​EXTENSION SCOUTING​ INFO DESK, which is open 10am-8pm.  
Come and meet our professionals of Accessibility and Extension scouting and try out how taking a coffee break would feel like if you had a disability that affected your mobility.​  
* The team also hosts the ​​​​MOBILITY AID EQUIPMENT TESTING AND BORROWING DESK which can be found at Leirisuora. The desk is open 10am-5pm  
with the exceptions of participating in the Night of Arts and occasions reserved beforehand.  
For those with assignments, assisting and mobility aid equipment race trainings will be held after regular opening hours.​  
On the race, you can **try out** how it feels like to move in a forest with mobility aid equipment or e.g. with a sight disability. You can also **borrow** the equipment for a brief period of time e.g. to help you getting to an activity situated in a difficult terrain.  
* Together with the Extension scouting team, we will organize different kinds of EDUCATION SESSIONS during the camp. Topics include e.g. communication, planning an accessible scouting event, assisting and using mobility aid equipment, extensive scouting etc. More information and the schedules at the info desks and the mobility aid equipment desk.  
* Accessibility team will offer help if you have a problem with any **aiding equipment and/or accessibility at the camp**.   
You can reach the **Accessibility team** through the general camp service number, or you can leave a contact request at the main camp office or at your subcamp office.   


####Extension scouting####  
 
Our objective:  

* to create a positive camp experience for scouts with disabilities  
* to organize some free time for extension scouting leaders  
* to spread information of​ extension scouting to other scouts, through their experiences  

The main principle is of course that we are in a forest camp, so one has to be prepared for rainfall and darkness, among other difficulties. Take initiative! Special organizing requires preparation beforehand and for that we need information from the local groups.  

The extension scouting team can be reached by phone or from the accessibility and extension scouting info desk of the main cafe.
The info desk is open 10am-8pm each day. You can ask questions about the extension scouts' programme, movements and other things regarding to the camp experience from the info desk, we are happy to help. There will also be information about extension scouting, planning an accessible scouting event and using different ways of communication. You can also expect star performers, such as the Different​ Friends (Toisenlaiset frendit).  

 
**The extension scouting programme at the camp**  

The main principle is that everyone pariticipates in the same programme as the rest of the camp unit each day. You can find more information on the activities from the info desk, and our extension scouting programme subteam leader will gladgly help you plan a day. ​​Besides this, you can visit the Tracker valleys each day 6pm-6:30pm. During this time the adults of the camp units get the opportunity to familiarize themselves with the valley of the next day and see the area. We hope that you inform us by phone or at the info desk which programme you will participate in the next day so that we can inform the Education team about it.  

 
**Movements of the scouts with disabilites**  

 You can ask for help with ordering transportation inside the camp when needed (e.g. to whole-camp programmes) from the info desk. You can also borrow equipment from the mobility aid equipment race for a brief period of time.  

**​Explorer assistants**  

 
One of the camp assignments for explorers is working as an extension scouting assistant. It has been checked out before the camp who might require an explorer-aged assistant, and we will get the assistants and the assistees together during the camp. Those who partake in the assistant assignment will receive education for the assignment at the camp before working.  

 
**Assignments of the scouts with disabilities**  

 
Some scouts with disabilities have an assignment of their own at the camp. Extension scouting team will support the scouts and inform the assignment employers. If you don't have an assignment, you can find et.al. two digital cameras at the info desk to document the everyday life of extension scouting. Explorer assignment personnel will help you with the use of the camera.  

**Extension scouting leaders' break shift workers and recreation**  
 
There will be a pre-camp inquiry about the need for breaks of the leaders and we will try to manage a breather for all of you in the middle of camp life. You can reserve a break shift worker for yourself from the info desk, remember to fill in the reservations the day prior, before 4pm! Don't hesitate to contact the info desk or the extension scouting leaders if you feel like your energy is draining out!  

There will be two meetings during the camp for the extension scouting leaders. Times and places will be announced at the camp, the meetings contain the same topics, so you can choose which one fits your schedule better. The meetings include an educational section, free chit-chat, a lil' bit of luxury and a coffee break.

name: Roihu's family camp Riehu
description:
Roihu's family camp Riehu rounds up children and their parents from all the subcamps.  There is a kindergarten and programme for school-age children at the family camp. On top of that, Riehu offers voluntary activities suitable for families with children. Kindergarten program and programme for school-age are only for pre-registrated children. It is not allower to bring sick child to the program.  

####Kindergarten####  

The kindergarten of Riehu is meant for the children whose parents are at their staff positions during the camp days. It is meant only for children speaking finnish or swedish.  

The kindergarten is open on 21-23 July and 25-27 July at 9.30 a.m. - 4.30 p.m. The daily morning group takes place at 9.30 a.m. – 13 p.m., the afternoon group at 1.40 p.m. – 4.30 p.m. and the whole day groups at 9.30 a.m. – 4.30 p.m. Please note that the schedules of the kindergarten have changed from those previously announced due to the changes in the whole camp's schedule.  

The children in the kindergarten will eat their lunch at the family camp's kitchen with the nannies. The lunch for these children will be served always at the family camp's kitchen during the six days the kindergarten is open, even if the child would keep a day off from the day care. Other meals are to be eaten with their camp unit at their subcamp's kitchen. This means that those living at the family camp will eat always at the family camp's kitchen.  

####Open kindergarten####  

Riehu's open kindergarten offers programme for children too young to attend school on 21-23 July and 25-27 July The child attends the open kindergarten's programme always with their guardian/adult responsible for them and is on their responsibility during the whole programme. Additionally to advance registration, the open kindergarten's programme requires registration at the camp at the Riehu's office. There can be different maximum amounts of participants to the activities and the groups will be filled at the camp in the order of registration. The children registered to the open kindergarten will eat their lunch at their subcamp's kitchen. Those living the family camp will eat at the family camp's kitchen.  

####Programme for the school-age children####  

Programme for the school-age children at the camp will be organized on 21-23 July and 25-27 July at 9.30 a.m. - 4.30 p.m. The child cannot join the programme in the middle of the day. The parents do not participate in the programme. An exception are personal assistants of those participating in extension scouting and international participants who do not speak Finnish, Swedish or English. The children are to be brought to the starting spot of the programme on the programme day by 9.30 a.m. The starting spot is located in the main road of Riehu (Riehun Raitti). The programme ends to the same spot at 4.30 p.m. The children need their parents' permission to leave from there on their own. Alternatively, the guardian or someone else (named beforehand) has to come to pick up the child. Please note that the schedules of the programme have changed from those announced earlier due to the changes in the whole camp's schedule.  

The children will eat their lunch during the day at the family camp's kitchen with their escort. The lunch for school-age children is always served at the family camp's kitchen on all the six days of programme, even though the child would keep a day off from the programme. Other meals they eat with their parents at their subcamp's kitchen. Those living in the family camp eat at the family camp's kitchen.  

####Other programme at the family camp####  

Aside from programme that requires advanced registration (kindergarten, open kindergarten and programme for school-age children), the family camp offers activities that are open for everyone, such as forest library, outdoor games and small activities for the whole family. The family camp' subcamp evening, Metsäsynttärit, will be held at the main stage on Monday 25 July.​ Because of the evening activities, on Monday 25, dinner is sered a bit earlier than in the other days. Please follow announcements in the camp area.   

####Adults at the camp####   

All the adults at the camp have a staff position. All the parents with school-age children and children registered to the kindergarten are expected to take a position. In a family with children under the school-age one of the parents can look after the children as their staff position and the other adults of the family are expected to take on other positions. Exception to this are the personal assistance of those participating in extension scouting and international participants who do not speak Finnish, Swedish or English.   

####Eating####  

People living in the family camp mainly eat at the family camp's kitchen. All the children registered to the kindergarten and the programme for school-aged children will eat their lunch at the family camp on all the six days of programme regardless of whether they take part in the programme of that day. The children registered for the open kindergarten will eat all their meals at their ​subcamp's kitchens every day. This means that those living in the family camp eat at the family camp's kitchen. Children living in other subcams may go to breakfast already 8.15 with their families.   

####Living####  

At the arrival to the camp, the participants will enroll to the family camp's office, where they will get the instructions for setting up their camp. Because Roihu and the family camp reached record amount of participants, it is at utmost importance that everyone will follow these instructions. Only this way the camp grounds can contain all the participants. There is no possibility to reserve tent spots. If two or more families wish to live next to each other at the camp, we recommend them to arrive at the same time. It is also possible for the first one arriving at the camp to bring and put up their friends' tent too. But it should be noted that the tent can be unoccupied only up to one day. Because the camp grounds are limited, there will not be a possibility for structures around the tents.​  

####Who is Riehu?####  

In Riehu, there lives also a joyful young girl, who is also called Riehu. The easiest way to find her is to listen for squeals of joy and bursts of laughter – from there you can usually find Riehu entertaining herself and the others. She never gets tired! When it is time to settle down, Riehu turns her jacket over and becomes Rauha. Her you can meet around the camp for example during the meal times.  

####More info about Riehu####  

Riehu's info letters for family campers and those participating family camp's programme can be find from the Roihu website [here](http://roihu2016.fi/en/familycamp).​

####Staff of Riehu####  

Leaders of Riehu: Kirsi Lehto, Mikko "Tammi" Jylhä  

Programme for school-age children: Taru-Maaria Hollanti, Maria Kivinen  

Kindergarten and open kindergarten: Outi Ylinen, Jari Juhola  

Common programmes: Mikko Kuitunen, Riina Aspila  

Maintenance: Tuomas Mäkinen, Heli Vuorinen  

Kitchen: Tiina Ruokonen  

Office: Iina Ojala, Inkeri Rantalainen, Marjo Majlund​

name: Activities on the Visiting day
description:
The Visiting day, Sunday 24 July, is a special day for everyone at the camp, both to those who have visitors coming and to those who do not.  

The Visiting day offers things to do and see, also to those who are not expecting visitors. Camp units, please make sure that the Trackers are not left alone if their friends have guests.  

####The programme activities are running as follows:####  

**Trackers: Vesilaakso (Valley of Water) from 10am to 12pm**  

Open activities: Paddling, SUP Board and Dragon Boat  

**Trackers: Elämyslaakso (Valley of Experiences) from 12pm to 2pm** 

Open activities: Campfire Karaoke, Tune Factory, Living Library, Brain Game, Cultural Casino and Animals  

**Trackers: Minälaakso (Valley of Me, Myself and I) from 2pm to 4pm**  

Open activities: all the sport activities (Flying Disc, Obstacle Course, Desk Floor Ball, Elephant Ball, Tandem and Raving)  

**Explorers:**  

Partly at Leirisuora (Promenade), for example, the World Village and Explorer Corner.  

**Rovers:**  

Global Development Village (GDV) and the Wheelchair Basketball at Leirisuora (Promenade). The Take Away activities are also available.   


*Please note:*

The age group activities are open for anyone who is interested, also the quests.  

Only some of the activities are open and we cannot guarantee participation for all the willing.  

####More things to do:####  

During the Visiting day you may also   

* stop by another village   
* complete some of the activities on RoihuApp   
* visit RoihuStore or the cafes  
* go around a walking trail  
* check out other subcamps and say hi to people you know  
* take it easy and relax  
* go to Frontstage to watch the programme  

Follow the camp media – more information about the available activities during the Visiting day will be published closer to the camp.  

In case you already know you will not have any visitors, you may go to Kehittämö to ask if they need help arranging the Visiting day.  

In the evening the whole camp will gather to the Stage for the Mid-Camp Ceremony.

name: RoihuAcademy - programme and open bagdes
description:
####RoihuAcademy####   

RoihuAcademy helps to make the skills learned at Roihu visible and more understandable in the non-scout world and helps you to ​make use of them for example in your future studies or employment. There are open badges for all age groups in staff positions at Roihu from explorers to adults. With these badges, you can inform others of your skills and knowledge.  

RoihuAcademy helps you on the way, whether it is about credits for studies, open badges or other issues related to your skills.  

You can always come to talk to the staff at RoihuAcademy: you can find us at the Parempi lippukunta area or at different workshops around the campsite. Also Palvelukeskus (the service center) and Kehittämö can help you with skill-related issues.  

 
####Programmes during the camp####   

RoihuAcademy organises several hands-on workshops and education sessions, which are targeted especially for rovers and adults. Workshops include for example how to utilize the skills you’ve learned in scouting in your studies, working life and when applying for a job.  

At the RoihuAcademy clinic you can find answers to questions about open badges. There are also good tips on how to talk about your skills learned in scouting to others.  

Additionally, RoihuAcademy organises scout-related seminars about university theses and meetings for teachers and entrepreneurs.  

Follow the notice boards and the camp newspaper. The schedule will be on the [Roihu website](http://www.roihu2016.fi/roihuakatemia).    

 

####Open badges – show your skills to others!####  

Open badge is an electronic proof of skills, which all explorers, rovers and adults in staff positions are able to apply for at the camp. The idea is that an open badge is not just a certificate of participation or a traditional recommendation letter. With the badge, you can describe your skills and it is in fact like a virtual badge on your uniform. Applying for the open badge is easy and also participants who are not scouts can apply. The three languages of the camp enable applying also to international scouts.   

 

**HOW DO I BENEFIT FROM THE BADGE?**  

* In scouts you’ve acquired many different skills, and you can easily tell others about these skills with the badge.  
* The open badge is a concrete certificate of the skills acquired.  
* You can use the badge in your studies or in future scout events.  
* The badge highlights your skills diversely when applying for a job or in working life.  
* With the badge, you can market your skills and attach them with profiles on social media.   
* The badge spreads knowledge of skills acquired through organisations and volunteer work.  

 
**THERE ARE THE FOLLOWING OPEN BADGES AT ROIHU:**  

* Camp pilots: Leader of young people at camp  
* Camp unit leaders: Leading a group at camp  
* Explorers: Finnjamboree Experience  
* ISTs in short staff positions: As a volunteer in events  
* ISTs in long staff positions: Skills in volunteer work  

 

**HOW DO I APPLY?**  

Applying for the badge is for individuals and the application can be filled online: just answer the questions on the application. The structure of the open badge enables that the skills are portrayed by several tag questions and you can also add attachments to emphasize your skills for example by adding a video or pictures. You can also attach feedback you’ve got from the staff position.  

The questions can be viewed in advance and during the staff position you can think about the answers beforehand and maybe take notes, film videos or take pictures.  

Applicants will be informed through email of the approval of the badge, and you can share this on social media or attach to an electronic CV.  

The badges are bestowed by The Guides and Scouts of Finland   

You can get acquainted with the badges in advance and activate the [Open Badge Passport](https://www.openbadgepassport.com)  

You can find more information about the badges and help familiarize your camp unit to the badges in advance by activating an account at Open Badge Passport. This is the place where all your personal badges will be displayed. It is a personal account where you can manage badges and decide where and how the information will be shared. Creating the account is free. When you create the account, you will be offered a possibility to accept the first badge!  

https://www.openbadgepassport.com/    


More information about open badges:   


[Roihu website](http://roihu2016.fi/roihuakatemia/osaamismerkki)    
[The Guides and Scouts of Finland website](http://toiminta.partio.fi/kouluttautuminen/osaamismerkit​)

name: ​Spirituality at Roihu
description:
What does spirituality in scouting mean to you? The peaceful forest path, a prayer of thanks for a problem solved, the best camp Masses, the wistful songs sung around a campfire, the utopistic talks with your friends...   

**​The spiritual programme at Roihu** consists of the religious and spiritual activities during the camp. It can be both confessional as well as non-denominational. The camp attenders form a huge congregation, where everyone can fulfil their spiritual needs as they wish.  

##Communions in the camp chapel##

Family mass (ev. lut.)    
* Sunday 24.7. at 3.30 pm

Evening communions (ev. lut)   
* Sunday, Monday, Tuesday at 10.15 pm
* Monday at 6.30 pm

Morning prayers (ev. lut.)   
* Monday at 8 am

Catholic mass    
* Tuesday at 4.30 pm

English mass (ev.luth)    
* Sunday at 2.30 pm

**Village priests in your support:** Each village of every subcamp has a youth leader or a priest ​from the Lutheran Church of Finland​. For camp units, the village priests will be the hearing ears, the helping hands, the support for small and big problems, and they will help you in organizing ​​​spiritual services. ​The camp units are also welcome to use the package of story and service ideas, gathered up by ​the village priests. In every subcamp there will also be a special place for relaxing, conversation and silence. ​​Adults can relax and meet a village priest also in the Oasis.  

**​The Spiritual team** ​​will gather a sum up of the different kinds of open religious and spiritual activities and services available at the camp to the Roihu webpage. You can also propose them to the Spiritual team or a village priest and take part in organizing them as well as participating in them.  

**​​​​​One big Spiritual Evening​:** ​The biggest events held by the team for Spiritual Programme are the Religious and Spiritual Evening prayers. The point of these events is to gather together, ponder, laugh and sing together. The religious option is held on the main stage, and its programme will be ecumenically Christian. The spiritual option means that there is no godly aspect in the programme: the event will focus on discussion on culture and values. The events are held at the same time and you are free to choose between the programmes, regardless of your religion.​ The ecumenical service will be televised and it comes out in August.  

Both of the big spiritual events are based on the education aims of the Guides and Scouts of Finland. ​​According to them, we as human beings have “responsibilities to one's God, to ourselves, to others, to the society and to the environment. Responsibilities and relationship to one's God means positive attitude towards their religion, seeking one’s spirituality and living by your spiritual belief as well as the community’s belief”.  

**The programme entities of the camp** ​also include religious education for different age groups.  

* You can get more information on the spiritual programme from the Spiritual team leader Salla Korteniemi.  
* Information on the village priests is given by Roihu youth priests Katri Vappula and Timo Lampi.

name: Programme for adults
description:
####Roihu offers programme for adults as well####   

​Aside from everyday staff positions, Roihu offers all kinds of pleasure and benefits for many purposes. Familiarize yourself at least with Oasis, Roihu academy, ​Parempi lippukunta -tent and all the cafés you can find. Adults are allowed to have fun at scouting, so take the chance and have a good laugh with other adults. Adult programme is age restricted; some activities are 18+, some are 22+.  
 
Excerpts from the adult programme; remember to follow information during the camp both on mobile and the notice boards.  

​**Barn dance courses**  

at Old Scouter Cafe in Oasis on July 21st to 26th at 1pm-3pm. Teachers from Tanssiseura Hurmio and the dances-to-be-taught change daily. More information on Oasis's Facebook page, Oasis's notice board and Camp office. Come alone (we have an efficient partner shifting system) or with a partner of your own.  

 
**​Barn dance**  

at Old Scouter Cafe in Oasis on July 27th at 1pm-4pm. During the first hour the dance teachers from Tanssiseura Hurmio will be giving guidance and we will go through what we have learned.  

 
​**GEYSIR - everything you've wanted to know about scouting**

Hour-long high-quality ​***workshops*** taught by Puuma-patrol will be held as per the schedule at Old Scouter Cafe in ​Oasis or in Puumala. Check out more information on Oasis's Facebook page, Oasis's notice board and Camp office.  

 
**Craft Lounge**   

​is there for adults' free time. Grab a cuppa joe from the neighbouring Old Scouters Cafe in ***Oasis***​​​, come and sit down to do handicrafts. Leather handband Roihakka only for adults (22+), the rest for rovers as well. Hands working, brain resting, you rejuvenating. Open ***9am-12:30pm and 2pm-9pm***.

name: Principles of programmes for each age group
description:
One of Roihu's main goals is to educate participants. Campers will learn something new and grow as people. Programme for each age group has been designed with this objective in mind, supporting the self-development of every Tracker, Rover and Explorer.  

####Programme structure####  
​
Specific programme and programme facilities have been developed for each age group.   

**Trackers** will explore one programme valley per day. There are six valleys in total.  

**Rovers and Explorers** can plan independently, or together with their pilots, how they will spend their time at the camp. Prior to camp, they should put together a 'camp timetable' displaying intended daily activities. As part of their camp programme, Rovers and Explorers will take care of their personal assignment, and participate in a 24-hour long will-o'-the-wisp.  

Various activities are offered for **Rovers** on different days. Rovers can pick and choose the activities they are interested in. Many of the activities are organised only once during the camp.  

####Programme etiquette####  

A large number of Trackers and Explorers will take part in the camp. This means flexible and positive camp attitude will come at hand. Most likely, queues will build up and the occasional delay and bottleneck cannot be avoided. Pilots are requested to try to maintain a jolly and relaxed atmosphere, even if everything doesn't always go according to plan.  

Introductory tours will be organised in all Tracker valleys for pilots and other adults almost every day. The tours present the area and activities; instructions and advice will be ​​also given so that Trackers will have as smooth as possible experience in the valleys. Similar tours will also be organised in Rover and Explorer valleys, but not as often. Details on tour times and dates can be found on age group programme websites (village leaders are also in the know).  



####Transportation to programme valleys and back####  

Campers will make their way to the programme valleys independently, taking whichever route they choose. Trackers will be escorted by pilots, whereas Rovers and Explorers travel on their own (or, according to other, camp unit-specific arrangements). In other words, relocation to programme valleys will not be organised on village or subcamp level (conversely, campers will be directed to make their way to the major communal events together with the people in their village/subcamp).   

####Daily gear####  

Campers should keep a basic set of gear on their person when taking part in daily activities outside their camp unit. In addition, some patrol-specific equipment will be needed in the activities. More detailed information will be provided for each age group. The idea is that when campers have everything they need in the activities with them, they can focus fully and efficiently on the programme of the day.  

####Meal times####

Campers will have their meals in their subcamp's kitchen following their camp unit or village's schedule. In the course of daily programme, campers will not return to their camp unit, but will have lunch on the go, meaning that they need to bring cutlery along for the day. Pilots will make sure that Trackers have lunch at some point during the day. Rovers and Explorers determine their meal times freely.   

####Pilot's role####  

Camp unit pilots have an important mission: to support, on their part, Trackers, Rovers and Explorers in making the most of the camp in terms of self-development and personal growth. For more information on this task, please see Camp unit > camp pilots.  

####Feedback and possible changes####  

Should any changes be made to the Tracker, Rover or Explorer programme, this will be communicated as soon as possible e.g. through village leaders.

name: Common events at Roihu
description:
####Common events at Roihu####  

During the camp four common events are held: the Opening Ceremony, religious or spiritual evening, the Mid-Camp Ceremony and the Closing Ceremony. The events are held at the Main Stage, apart from the spiritual evening, which is held on the Second Stage called Front Stage.  

Getting to the event area is done according to your subcamp and by following the instructions of the camp security, Turva. The camp units will follow the directions given at their subcamps. In order for everything to go smoothly, each camp unit should also take care of their foreign guests so that everyone will be ready on time for the events. Each subcamp has their area around the stage. The audience area has ​marked security paths which must be kept clear throughout all of the events. There are so many of us that some of the subcamps will have to wait for fairly long periods of time before the event begins. The stage screen will show some entertaining footage, and perhaps even interactive shows, during the waiting periods, both before and after the events. Turva will give instructions on departing for the subcamps and camp units.  

***The common events team requests camp units to inform the campers of these following safety instructions for the common events:***  

1. Wear weather appropriate clothing: warm clothes for cold weather, a head piece for hot and sunny and water proof gear for when it is raining (no umbrellas).  
2. Especially on hot days make sure you hydrate yourself well and carry a drinking bottle with you to all programmes. The bottle cannot be refilled during the common events.  
3. Bring necessary personal medication and instructions with you, for example an inhaler for an asthma attack, an EpiPen or anything else you may have been prescribed. A rescue team will be on duty during the events.  
4. Starting a fire and smoking cigarettes in the area is absolutely forbidden.  
5. Flashing lights and special effects are used in the shows. The sound volume will be kept at a reasonable level following the official guidelines, but we recommend parents to consider protecting the hearing of younger children.  

***What should I bring with me to the common events?***

* Weather appropriate clothing  
* A filled water bottle  
* A seat pad  
* A mobile phone (may be needed during the event)  
* Personal medication with instructions, in case of a fit etc.  
* A cheerful mood and plenty of patience  

Potential questions related to the common events should primarily be presented to your village chief or other subcamp staff.   

If more information is needed from the common event team, contact:  

Production Assistant Heidi Kajasto        
(heidi.kajasto@roihu2016.fi , during the camp 046 56 04 064)  

**THE OPENING CEREMONY OF ROIHU, IGNITION, IS CELEBRATED ON WEDNESDAY 20 JULY ON THE MAIN STAGE.**  

Roihu's Ignition is a flashy opening, which wishes everyone at Roihu welcome to the camp and boosts good team spirit and feeling of togetherness. The Roihu story, which has already beg​un during the Sparks, will continue at the Opening Ceremony, and you get to enjoy good music, participate in the show, admire fire performances and get to know some of the foreign guests at the camp.  

Schedule:  

* Arrival 19:00 – 20:00  
* Programme 20:00 – 21:00  
* Departing 21:00 – 22:00  

**THE RELIGIOUS AND SPIRITUAL PROGRAMME AT ROIHU (DENOMINATIONAL OR NON-DENOMINATIONAL) IS HELD ON SATURDAY 23 JULY AT THE MAIN STAGE AND THE FRONT STAGE**  

Two different events are held at the same time. Both follow the same schedule:  

* Arrival 19:00 – 20:00  
* Programme 20:00 – 21:00  
* Departing 21:00 – 22:00  

***The denominational programme*** means, that the event consists of a confession. The denominational programme at Roihu follows the ecumenically Christian confession. The programme includes other Christian elements too, such as a Christian service (prayer, confession of sins, Christian music), but it will be presented by actors and a priest, rather than just being read out.  

***The non-denominational programme*** does not include a confession, but handless spiritual topics through ethical questions and everyday examples.  

Both events undergo the four educational aims (relationship to yourself, to others, to society and the nature) through the fifth basic scouting value, "relationship to God": "Relationship to God means having a positive attitude towards faith and living up to your own belief and society". The participant's partaking in the programme of their choosing allows them to get the educational values which are close to their beliefs.  

**Getting to the programme area**

Before the programme the camp unit will make something together according to the given instructions. Camp units will move to the event stages by themselves. On the way there are signs, and after the fourth one the camp unit should separate into those who go towards the denominational event at the Main Stage and those who go to the non-denominational event at the Front Stage.  


**THE MID-CAMP CEREMONY OF ROIHU, FLAME, IS CELEBRATED ON SUNDAY 24 JULY AT THE MAIN STAGE.**

The mid-camp ceremony recaps the beginning part of the camp and prepares for the rest of it. Onstage you will also see a few brave performers who took part in the Roihu audition tour and lots and lots of other exciting stuff!  

Schedule:  

* Arrival 19:00 – 20:00  
* Programme 20:00 – 21:00  
* Departing 21:00 – 22:00  
 

**THE CLOSING CEREMONY OF ROIHU, BLAZE, IS CELEBRATED ON WEDNESDAY 27 JULY AT THE MAIN STAGE.**  

The Blaze is the high point of the whole camp. The Closing Ceremony is like a big party, where you reminiscence the camp together whilst spending time with your new and old friends for one last time during the camp. The purpose of the Closing Ceremony is to give the participants a feeling of togetherness, which is the best thing about scouting. The Closing Ceremony will end at the world's biggest CAMP PARTY!  

Schedule (*Please note the earlier start than other common events!!!*)  

* Arrival 19:30–20:30
* Programme 20:30–22:00  
* Departing 22:00–23:00  


**SECOND STAGE "FRONT STAGE"**

The Second Stage, a.k.a., the Front Stage is the stage at the end of the Leirisuora. Events and shows are held there from 9 in the morning till 21.30 in the evening. Both professionals and amateurs will be performing onstage.   

The stage is relatively small and there is room for roughly 500 people to sit or stand in front of it. A big screen is placed next to the stage, which will be showing footage of the camp, ads and be used for the shows onstage.  

The stage will be at a very central place and each camper should be able to find it on their way to their activities or the centre of the camping area. The idea is to hold "open stage" typed events during the camp, when any passer-by is allowed to get on the stage and perform.  

There will be spectacular music shows, seminars, morning workouts, sing-alongs and discos! You should pay attention during the visiting day also, since you might catch someone familiar on the stage. Please come watch and experience great programming together with us!  

The person in charge of the Second Stage is the Production Assistant of the common events, Sara Sarkkinen. Ideas and requests about the open slots to perform can be inquired during the camp too.   

**You are very welcome to join in making the common events unforgettable experiences to all of us!**

name: Brushing your teeth
description:
####Brushing your teeth####  

In the camp units, a bucket will be used as a​ toothbrushing waste dish, as it is easy to transport it into the toilets to be emptied. It is also possible to brush your teeth​ in connection with a toilet visit, as the waters can then be easily be disposed of. The maintenance unit will provide one bucket with a lid for the toothbrushing water, so possible additional buckets or other necessary dishes must be brought by the camp unit.​

name: Showers
description:
####Showers####  

The common showers at the camps are located in two places: north near the kindergarten and south next to Vesilaakso.    

The showers are open from 8 am onwards. The northern shower is closed 30 minutes before silence in the camp. The southern shower is closed at the same time with the 'evening café'.   

The saunas located at the showers are open mainly during the showers' opening hours (excluding certain special reservations).  

*To make sure that everyone gets to enjoy a pleasant shower experience, you should remember the following things:*    

* To preserve the nature, only biodegredible soaps and shampoos are allowed at the showers.  
* There is only a limited amount of showers, so please aim to finish your business in a reasonable time.  
* There is only limited space to change your clothes, so please avoid bringing unnecessary items to the shower facilities.  
* Due to ​fragrance sensitivities, using strongly scented products in the shower and in the dressing room is prohibited.  
* The shower faculties are not meant for dying hair, doing laundry, water fights etc.  
* Please help to keep the shower faculties clean.  

Wash Team patrols at the showers during the opening hours and is happy to help with any problems.

name: Rovers' program
description:
####Majavanpesä####  

Majavanpesä is ​​a programme valley for rovers where one can find things to do on each day of the camp. Majavanpesä offers directed activities as well as a place for hanging out. You can find information of the activities from the piloting tool and the ​​Rover Programme Info at Leirisuora (the main street). The activities will change daily and some of them are offered only once during the camp. Schedule of the activities will be in the supplements (ready by the end of May). Come to Majavanpesä to spend time alone or with friends by playing games, listening to music or reading books. Majavanpesä is open 10:00-24:00 every day.  

####Take away activities####  

​​​One does not always have the time to go to Majavanpesä to check what they have to offer.​​ If that's the case, you can go and get yourself a take away activity! Take away activities are brief or adaptable-in-their-length activities which you can perform with the group you want. Take away activities are offered in subcamp offices/cafés and in the Rover Programme Info at Leirisuora (the main street) There will be lots of activities and they will change daily.​​​  

####Open badge####  

All Rovers can apply to an Open badge according to their staff position. Open badge is like a virtual proficiency badge and with it ​the applicant can describe their capabilities to others. Short assignments, i.e. only during the camp staff members, can apply to "Volunteering in an ​event" bagde. The ones participating in a longer assignment can apply to "Competency from volunteering" badge. Longer assignment is such that has begun prior to the camp/lasts longer than the camp.   

More information on the open badges can be aquired from RoihuAcademy.  

####Rovers' working life theme day 25 July####  

​RoihuAcademy and Rover Activities are organizing Rovers' work​ing life theme day on Monday 25 July. Scouty working life fair will begin in the morning with ​​enthusiastic speakers as we will hear the stories of Mikko Kuitunen from Vincit and of other scouts in important posts in their working life. In the afternoon the Rovers will participate in active workshops where they will receive some practical tips on how to use their scouting competency in working life as well as answers to other questions on working life and career developing. The day will culminate in a disco.  

More precise schedule of the day and the schedule of RoihuAcademy will be published in [RoihuAcademy's website](http://roihu2016.fi/en/about-roihu/roihuacademy). Remember also to follow ​​the bulletin boards and the camp magazine!​

name: In case of emergency
description:
####Emergency procedure####  
 
1. Save those in immediate danger.  
2. Ensure your own safety.  
3. Warn others e.g. by shouting or blowing in a whistle​.  
4. Call 112. Mention that you are calling from ROIHU scout camp.  
5. Extinguish. There are plenty of fire extinguishers/extinguishing water in the area.  
6. Confine the ​fire if you're unable to put it out.  
7. Lead the emergency personnel to the destination.  

 
**Call the emergency number 112 e.g.**
 
* when you notice a fire that you can't put out immediately   
* when you notice someone drowning  
* when you urgently need help of authorities   
* when life, health, belongings or environment is threatened or in danger   

 
**Call the ​Medical team hotline +358 45 692 9219  e.g.**

* when you need transportation for an injured  
* when you are injured/become ill and don't know where you should go  
* when you need health counsel  
* ​​when it's not an emergency, transport the patient to the ​First Aid or to the camp hospital (remember an escort)  
 
 
**Call camp info 010 190 110 e.g.**

* ​in case of non-urgent emergencies  
* if you have noticed a fire that you've been able to put out yourself/selves  
* when you need to ask or inquire something  
* in case of disruption where no one is in danger: electrical outtakes etc.  
* if you need help with ​ground wasps, vipers etc.  
* if you suspect a crime  
* if someone has got lost  
​
####CALLING THE EMERGENCY NUMBER 112​####  

***If you can, use the 112 SUOMI mobile app to call 112.*** The emergency service dispatcher will automatically receive the location of the caller when you call via the app. You can thus speed up the helping process and you don't have to know your exact location.  
​
**What to do:**  ​

1. Make the emergency call yourself if you can.  
    *call from a safe place*  

2. Tell what has happened.  

3. Tell the precise address and municipality.  
    *ROIHU SCOUT CAMP, Rahtijärventie 121 Evo/Hämeenlinna*   

4. Answer any questions.  

5. Act upon the directions you're given.  

6. Don't hang up until you're allowed to.  

​​If you are calling from a mobile phone you don't need an area code.

name: ​​​Kumppani- ja kutsuvieraskylä
description:
Roihua on ollut tekemässä laaja joukko yhteistyökumppaneita, joita ilman leiri ei olisi mahdollinen. Roihulla on yli sata yritys- ja yhteisökumppania, joiden tuki näkyy jokapäiväisessä arjessa leirillä.  

Roihun leirisuoran sydämestä, pääkahvilaa vastapäätä, löytyy leirin kumppani- ja kutsuvieraskylä, jossa esittätyvät suurimmat Roihun kumppaneista. Toiminnalliset pisteet ovat näyteikkunoita leiriprojektin mahdollistaneisiin yhteistyöhankkeisiin.  

Kumppanuusprojekteja esittelevät kylässä yhdessä sekä partiolaiset että yhteistyökumppanien edustajat. Kylän toiminnot on avoinna päivittäin 10–20.  

Tietoa kaikista Roihun kumppaneista löydät osoitteesta roihu2016.fi/kumppanit  

Huomioihan, että leiriorganisaatio on myös sopinut näiden virallisesti leiriä tukevien kumppaneiden kanssa mahdollisesta kumppaninäkyvyydestä itse leirialueella, joten muiden kuin Roihun virallisten kumppaneiden näkyminen leirialueella ei ole sallittua.

name: Caféer och butiker
description:
####Caféerna####  

Roihus caféer bjuder på läckra pauser mitt i lägervimlet.

**Live** är det största caféet på lägret. Live hittar du på Lägerrakan mitt i lägret. Caféet har öppet från 9.00–21.00. På Live finns det att köpa någonting gott att äta, internationellt program och utrymmen att ha möten och träffar i. Om du har fått nog av lägermaten kan Lives krispiga salladsbar vara ett gott alternativ! Det finns även en kiosk på Live när du behöver påfyllning av godisförrådet eller behöver köpa myggmedel och hygienartiklar. Café Live är live. På scenen ser vi förträffliga framträdanden under hela lägertiden.


**Express-Caféerna, Intro, Tauko, Tempo och Soolo** servar hungriga och törstiga lägerdeltagare på olika håll i lägret.  
**Intro** hittar ni i den norra ändan av Polte. Intro är öppet 10.00–22.00. Vill du ha sockervadd kommer du till Intro!
**Tauko** erbjuder lugn och ro. Du hittar Tauko på Lägerrakan i bastuändan. Tauko har öppet varje dag kl. 10.00–22.00. Kom och ligg i hängmattan och lyssna på lugn LP-musik.  
**Tempo** är som namnet anger ett café med snabba takter. Tempo är öppet redan från kl. 7.00 ända fram till kl. 22.00. Det är svårt att missa detta café för att detta tvåvåningscafé syns och kanske hörs ända från Lägerrakans norra del. I Tempo kan du njuta av ditt specialkaffe på takterassen!  
**Soolo** är platsen att hänga på. Detta café väljer varje trendmedveten Roihudeltagare. Soolo är beläget mellan Raiku och Syke och här njuter vi av musik som knappast hörs på Radio Nova. Paninis och coola typer finns också på Soolo som har öppet varje dag kl. 10.00–22.00.

**Club Encore** är hela Finlands hetaste pop-up-nattklubb! Club Encore är ett café dit man kan gå för att trivas, festa, äta och för att träffa nya och gamla vänner.  Hot Dogs och bästa stämningen på Club Encore erbjuds varje kväll kl. 18.00–02.00 vid Rahtijärviväfen nära Minä-laakso (Jag-dalen). Club Encore är även i vuxnas smak!

**Old Scouters Café** är ett mångsidigt scoutcafé i vuxen smak. Caféet hittar du i Oasen nära Humina och är öppet kl. 9.00–01.00. Efter kl. 18.00 är det åldersgräns på 18 år. Här serveras enastående egenhändigt gjorda bakverk. Här kan du även grilla korv och pinnbröd vid caféets stämningsfulla brasa. Förutom att njuta av läckerheter kan du också följa med på logdanskurs, göra dig ett eget Roihu-armband i läder, sjunga scoutsånger, swoppa (byta grejer), medverka i Puuma-patrullens läroverkstäder och bekanta dig med SPYP:s Scoutsamlare. Efter kl. 22.30 forsätter vi med kvällste på den lugna strandterassen.

I alla caféer är det möjligt att ladda Roihus powerbanks mot en liten slant. Du byter din tomma powerbank mot en laddad och betalar en liten slant för detta. På detta sätt kan du ladda din mobil även under dagtid till och med i programdalarna!

####Glasskioskerna####  

Mjukglass för de sugna finns att köpa på Duuri och Moll. Glasskioskerna hittar ni längs Lägerrakan. De långa köerna krymper i snabb takt och det kommer att vara värt den oundvikliga väntan. Glasskioskerna är öppna kl. 9.00–21.00.

 
####Restaurang Chéz Tilhi####  

**Chéz Tilhi** kommer med fine dining till sjöstrand och skog. Tilhi sköter om cateringen på lägret, vare sig det handlar om lägerkårens födelsedagsbeställningar eller om ledarnas pizzakvällar. Romantiska stearinljusmiddagar och Take away –portioner efter en tung arbetsdag är Tilhis vardag. Stora beställningar kan göras i förväg men du är också välkommen att dyka upp när som helst med din vän för en gourméupplevelse. För att undvika fördröjningar i servicen är det bra att göra sin beställning i förväg.  Vissa dagar kan man även få njuta av Tilhis brunch och speciella temakvällar- följ informationen om detta på www.facebook.com/tilhet eller på www.tilhet.fi

Tilhi är öppet enligt beställningar och om kvällarna vanligtvis mellan kl. 17.00–00.30. Tilhi hittar ni i korsningen mellan Rahtijärvivägen och Saukonojantie i riktiningen mot sjön. 
 
####Lägerbutiken####   

**Indie** är BUTIKEN med diverse Roihu–produkter och den hittar ni längs Lägerrakan bredvid café Live. I butiken finns det att köpa lägermodets must-have och de traditionella samlingsprodukterna som brukar finnas på storläger. Sakerna i butiken är så bra att de tas ur händerna på dig så skynda dig att shoppa redan i början av lägret!

name: Besöksdagens aktiviteter
description:
Besöksdagen söndagen den 24.7 är en speciell dag på lägret för alla lägerdeltagare, för såväl de som får besök som för de som inte får det.  

På besöksdagen bjuds det på saker att se och göra, också för de som inte får besökare. Ni sköter väl om i lägerkårerna att speciellt ingen spejarscout inte blir lämnade ensamma om kompisarna får besök.  

####Lägrets åldersgrupprogram är öppna enligt följande:####  

**Spejarscouternas vattendal kl. 10-12**  

Öppna aktiviteter: paddling, dragon boat och SUP bräda  

**Spejarscouternas upplevelsedal kl. 12-14**  

Öppna aktiviteter: lägereldsångskaraoke, låtfabriken, levande biblioteket, intellektspel, kulturernas kasino och djuren.  

**Spejarscouternas jag-dal kl.14-16**  

Alla SportRambo aktiviteter är öppna: frisbee, hinderbana, bordsähly, elefantboll, tandem och revning.  

**Explorerprogram** delvis på Promenaden. T.ex. Världsbyn och Explorercorner  

**Roverscoutprogram** i Global Development Village (GDV) och på Promenaden rullstolskorgboll. Rovrarnas take away-aktiviteter är också tillgängliga.  

*Observera:*  

Alla kan bekanta sig med åldersgruppsaktiviteterna, också besökarna.  

Endast en del av aktiviteterna är öppna och man kan inte garantera att alla som vill slipper och delta.  


####Annat att göra:####  

På besöksdagen kan man också:

* besöka partnerskapsbyn  
* genomföra RoihuApp aktiviteter  
* besöka RoihuStore eller caféerna  
* gå på vandringsrutterna  
* besöka andra underläger och hälsa på bekanta  
* ta det lugnt och vila  
* titta på Frontstage program  

Följ med lägrets media – där publiceras tilläggsuppgifter om besöksdagens aktivitetsmöjligheter.  

Om man på förhand redan vet att man inte får besökare så kan man också gå och fråga till Uppdragskiosken om det behövs hjälp inför besöksdagen.  

På besöksdagens afton samlas hela lägret på Stage för Midfest.

name: Tandtvättning
description:
####Tandtvättning####  

Vi ber att lägerkårerna tar med sig ett lockförsett ämbar dit lägerdeltagarna kan spotta i samband med tandtvättningen. Ämbaret töms vid toaletterna.

name: Duschar
description:
####Duschar####  

Det finns duschar och bastu på två ställen på lägerområdet. I norr bredvid familjelägret och i söder bredvid vattendalen.   

Duscharna kan användas dagligen from. kl. 8.00. Duscharna intill familjelägret stängs 30 min före tystnad. Duscharna intill vattendalen stängs samtidigt som nattcaféet.   

Bastuna är i användning huvudsakligen då duscharna är öppna. Undantagsvis kan det finnas reservationer. Visst ser du till att du också hinner tvätta dig innan duscharna stängs ifall du badar sent.    

Beakta följande:   

* Använd enbart bionedbrytbara tvättmedel.  
* Det finns ett bergänsat antal duschar. Försök vara rask.   
* Utrymmet i omklädningsrummen är begränsat. Undvik att ta med dig extra grejer när du kommer för att tvätta dig.   
* Det är förbjudet att använda produkter som är rikligt parfymerade för att respektera personer som överkänsliga.   
* Duscharna och omklädningsrummen är inte ämnade för hårfärjning, vattenkrig, klädtvätt...  
* Håll utrymmena snygga och städiga!     

Tvätteamet dejourerar vid duscharna under öppethållningstiderna och hjälper gärna till vid problemsituationer.   ​

name: Toaletterna
description:
####Toaletterna####   

På Roihu kommer det att finnas bajamajor runt om i lägret. Använd de bajamajor som finns närmast er. På vissa ställen kommer det även att finnas handikapptoaletter, som i första hand är till för de behövande. Av hygienskäl är vissa toaletter reserverade för en viss målgrupp t.ex. kökspersonal. Visst låter bli att använda dessa toaletter även om de skulle vara olåsta.   


####Toalettpapper och snygghet####   

Toalettpapper fylls på med jämna mellanrum. Ifall papret är slut i någon toalett är det bra att meddela om det t.ex. till underlägerkanslien. Meddela också ifall toaletten är överfull eller ser eländig ut. Varje toalett är märkt med en kod som meddelas då något problem rapporteras. Då är det lättare för serviceenheten att åtgärda eventuella problem.   

Toalettpappret används bara för vad det är tänkt för, så att det räcker till alla under hela lägertiden.  

Behoven görs sittande oberoende vad man är van vid. Vid behov kan man torka av sitsen med toalettpapper.   


####Köer####  

Köbildning kommer att vara oundvikligt, speciellt om morgnarna, visa hänsyn till varandra.

name: Vid brand eller olycksfall
description:
####Riktlinjer för hur du skall agera vid en brand eller vid en olyckshändelse####  

1. Rädda de som är i omedelbar fara.  
2. Utsätt dig inte själv i fara.  
3. Varna andra t.ex. genom att skrika på hjälp eller genom att blåsa i en visselpipa.  
4. Larma genom att ringa 112. Nämn att du ringer från scoutlägret ROIHU.  
5. Försök släcka branden om det är frågan om en brand. Det finns gott om brandsläckare/vatten på lägerområdet.  
6. Begränsa elden om du inte kan släcka den.  
7. Vägled räddningspersonalen till olycksplatsen.   

**Ring SOS numret 112 när:**

* du märker en brand och inte själv kan släcka den.   
* du ser någon som håller på att drunkna.  
* du behöver snabbt myndigheten på plats.  
* hälsan eller liv är hotat eller när egendom eller miljön är hotad eller är i fara.    

**​Ring till sjukvårdsteamet på journumret 045 692 9219 när:**

* du behöver ordna transport till en skadad.  
* du själv är skadad/sjuk och inte vet vart du bör gå/åka.  
* du behöver hälsoråd.  
* en patient behöver föras till en förstahjälpen station eller till lägersjukhuset men inte akut (kom ihåg att ledsagare behövs alltid med)  

**Ring lägerinfo på 010 190 110:** 

* vid icke akuta olycksfall.  
* om du märkt en brand och lyckats släcka den själv.   
* om du har frågor som du måste få svar på.  
* vid olika slags störningar, där ingen är i fara: elavbrott, rusning/stockning  
* om du behöver hjälp med jordgetingar, huggormar osv.  
* om du misstänker brott   
* om någon har gått vilse  

Servicecentret meddelar uppdragen vidare till brandkåren och till säkerhetsteamet.  

 

####ATT RINGA TILL SOS NUMRET 112####  

***Ring om möjligt via 112 FINLAND- mobilappen.***  
Larmcentralens jour kan då automatiskt lokalisera den som ringer. På detta sätt påskyndas processen med att få hjälp, och du behöver inte själv försöka komma underfund med varifrån du ringer.​  

**Gör så här:**

1. Ring om möjligt själv nödnumret från en säker plats.  

2. Berätta om vad som har hänt.  

3. Tala om varifrån du ringer, gärna exakt adress och kommun   
*Scoutlägret ROIHU, Rahtijärventie 121, Evo/Hämeenlinna*  

4. Svara på frågorna.  

5. Agera enligt anvisningarna som ges.  

6. Lägg på luren först när du får lov.   

Om du ringer från en mobiltelefon så behövs inte riktnummer​​.

name: Brandsäkerhet
description:
####Lägerbrandkåren####  

* På lägret finns en lägerbrandkår som är färdig att rycka ut.  
* Lägerbrandkåren är utrustad med brandbilar och fyrhjulingar.  
* Lägerbrandkåren ansvarar för släcknings- och räddningsuppgifter. Lägerbrandkåren gör också brandinspektioner och har övervakningsuppgifter.  
* Lägerbrandkåren fungerar i samarbete med myndigheterna. Lägerbrandkåren larmas via räddningscentralen.  
* Icke brådskande fall kan anmälas till servicecentralen som vidarebefordrar begäran till brandkåren.  


####Att göra upp öppen eld####  

* Att tända en brasa på lägerområdet är förbjudet utan anmälan. Brasor får tändas endast på utmärkta eldplatser. Alla eldplatser är numrerade.  
* Att göra upp annan öppen eld är helt och hållet förbjuden.  
* Då det råder fara för skogsbrand är det förbjudet att göra upp öppen eld också på eldplatserna och lov beviljas inte.  
* Eldplatserna byggs av betongringar. Bottnen är täckt med sand. Bredvid eldplatsen skall finnas en släckningstunna fylld med vatten och ett 10 l ämbar. Anmäl tomma tunnor till lägrets info.  

**Vad avses med öppen eld?**  

* ***En öppen eld är en eld som kan sprida sig till omgivningen via gnistor eller via marken.***  
* En traditionell lägereld är en öppen eld.  
* Ett utfärdskök som står direkt på marken är en öppen eld. Om köket däremot placeras på ett bord t.ex. i ett kokskjul räknas det inte som öppen eld.    
* En från marken väl isolerad skorstensförsedd bastuugn i vilken bränns enbart ved av lövträd räknas inte som öppen eld.  
* En murad väl från marken isolerad grill är inte öppen eld om ved av lövträd används.  
* Bollgrillar, engångsgrillar och motsvarande som lätt trillar omkull är öppen eld.  
* Som gränsfall räknas övriga ugnar och kaminer som isolerats väl från marken och som har gnistskydd och i vilka enbart ved av lövträd bränns.  


####Att anmäla en lägereld####  

* Då du gör upp eld på någon av de färdigt utmärkta eldplatserna på lägerområdet handla så här:  
Den ansvariga vuxna anmäler lägerelden med SMS till numret (*kommer här senare*). Skriv [ditt eget namn] SYTYTTÄÄ NUOTION [eldplatsens kod] eller ringa och meddela att "person x tänder en eld på eldplats nummer x".  

* När gruppen har för avsikt att sluta, ser den ansvariga vuxna till att elden slocknat och att det inte finns risk för omgivningen att antändas. Därefter sänder hen ett SMS till numret xxx. Skriv [ditt eget namn] SAMMUTTI NUOTION [eldplatsens kod] eller ring och meddela att "person x släckte elden på eldplats nummer x".  


####Förhandssläckning####  

* Säkerhetsteamet förser underlägret med släckningsvatten. För varje påbörjat 100-tal lägerdeltagare finns en 200 l stor vattentunna med lock samt 2–4 släckningsämbar. Vattnet i tunnan är endast till för eventuell släckning. Anmäl lägrets info om tunnan är mindre en halvfull med vatten.  

* Alla de lägerkårer som har en gasdriven apparat, t.ex. en gastrangia eller annat gasdrivet utfärdskök med sig bör vara utrustade med en 6 kg/l brandsläckare och en brandfilt!  

    * Brandsläckare 6 kg  
      
      Minimikrav på effektklass: 27A 144BC. En pulversläckare kan ersättas med en vätskesläckare (även kallad skumsläckare) vars storlek är minst 6 l och effektklass minst 13A 144B eller en koldioxidsläckare vars storlek är minst 5 kg. På lägret skall brandsläckaren vara placerad så att den är lättillgänglig och nära gasköket. OBS! Brandsläckaren bör vara granskad!  

    * Brandfilt 120 cm x 180 cm.    

* Lägerkåren ansvarar själv för anskaffning av släckningsutrustningen.  

Ifall du märker att något brinner, ring 112 och försök släcka elden enligt bästa förmåga. Se till att du tryggar din egen säkerhet.  


####Användning av flytgas####   

* Lägerkåren har rätt att ta med sig gas och kokutrustning t.ex. för kokning av kaffe. Utrustningen granskas av Roihus säkerhetsorganisation i början av lägret och den skall uppfylla kraven som ställs i flytgasdirektiven. Dessutom granskas släckningsutrustningen. Säkerhetsorganisationen antecknar vilken utrustning som medtagits.   
* Högst 25 kg flytgas får förvaras i lägerkåren. Gasflaskor som överskrider mängden förvaras i lägrets gasförråd.  
* Enligt gällande bestämmelser får gasslangen vara högst 120 cm lång. T-anslutningar utan spärr får inte installeras. Ifall en anslutning installeras måste det finnas en spärr åt varje håll och slangarnas sammanlagda längd får inte överskrida 120 cm.  
* Granska gasutrustningens täthet med tvållösning innan användning.   
* Ifall du känner gaslukt vid användning skall du omedelbart stänga gasventilen. Därefter skall du ta reda på var gasen läcker t.ex. med tvållösning och byta ut trasiga delar.    
* Flaskorna bör alltid stå upprätta med ventilen uppåt. Försäkra dig om att gasflaskan inte kan trilla omkull.  


####Flytgassäkerhet####  
 
Större gasbrännare/ringbrännare:

* Ställs på ett oantändligt underlag, så att om brännaren faller når inte lågorna marken eller annat antändligt material  
* Max. 25 kg gas får finnas i närheten av brännaren t.ex. i tältet eller under taket. Gasflaskor som överskrider mängden förvaras i lägrets gasförråd.  
* Utrustningen skall vara CE-märkt.  
* Används under uppsikt av vuxen.  
* Ifall det råder varning för skogsbrand är användning tillåten endast med specialtillstånd av lägerbrandkåren.  

Trangior eller mindre utfärdskök:

* Användning tillåten på oantändligt underlag.  
* Användning endast under uppsikt av vuxen.  

​Observera kraven på släckningsutrustning som det står mera om under stycket förhandssläckning.  

**BYTE AV FLYTGASFLASKA**  

* Då du byter flaska, se till att gasen inte används och att gasventilen är stängd. ​

name: Fire safety
description:
####Camp fire brigade####  

* At the camp there is a fire brigade ready to be dispatched immediately.  
* The fire brigade consists of fire engines and all-terrain-vehicles, which can easily move around the camp area.  
* The fire brigade will perform all firefighting and rescue tasks at the camp. The duty of the fire brigade is to maintain preparedness for a quick and large-scale dispatch and to perform different kinds of rescue tasks efficiently. The fire brigade will also perform fire inspection and supervision tasks.   
* The fire brigade co-operates with the officials. The fire brigade receives the alarms straight from the emergency exchange/rescue department.   
* In unhurried cases you can contact the camp info.  

 
####Open flame####   

* Open flame (campfires) in the camp area are forbidden without an open flame notification.  
* Other open fire are completely forbidden.  
* Campfires can be set up only in the specifically assigned campfire areas. All campfire areas are numbered.  
* During a fire forest warning all open fire and campfires are forbidden, all permits will be denied.  
* A campfire can be set up inside a concrete pipe with a sufficient amount of sand at the bottom so that the ground does not catch fire. At the campfire area there should be a water barrel and also a 10 liter bucket for the extinguishing water. If you notice an empty barrel, please inform this to the camp info.  


**What is an open flame?**

* ***An open flame is a fire that can spread to the surrounding areas either by sparks or burning ground.***  
* A traditional campfire is an open flame.  
* A primus cooker set directly on the ground is an open flame. On a wooden table of a cooking shelter it is not an open flame.  
* A solely hardwood-burning stove of a tent sauna with a chimney insulated from the ground is not an open flame. In a stove with a dense spark arrestor on the chimney, all types of wood can be used.  
* A masonry fireplace insulated from the ground is not an open flame, if solely hardwood is used.  
* The following are open flames: a three-legged sphere-shaped grill that tips easily, other unstable grills and non-returnable grills.  
* Some borderline cases include: sturdy fireplaces standing on their own, equipped with a spark arrestor, burning solely hardwood and with the loose soil removed beneath and around a one-meter radius.  


####Notification of a campfire####   

* When setting up a campfire on a pre-assigned campfire area (marked on the map), the adult in charge of the fire informs of the campfire by sending a text message to the following number (*announced later*).  
The contents of the message should be as follows: "[your name] IGNITES THE CAMPFIRE [insert the number of the campfire area here]". The notification can also be made by calling.  
*"Milla Roihu ignites the campfire 06"*  

* Termination of the campfire: 
When the adult in charge of the campfire has extinguished the fire, checked the surroundings in case of smouldering and is ready to be the last one to leave the camp fire area, he/she sends another text message: "[your name] HAS EXTINGUISHED THE CAMPIRE [insert the number of the campfire area here]" The notification can also be made by calling.  
*"Milla Roihu has extinguished the campfire 06"*   

 
####First-aid extinguishing####   

* The security will organize a 200-liter water barrel to the sub camps and camp units, one for every 100 people, and 2-4 water buckets beside the barrels. The barrels will be marked. The barrels are meant for first-aid extinguishing only. Please inform the camp info if you notice a barrel which water level is less than half of the capacity.  

* All camp units that use any gas-burning equipment, primus cooker etc. has to have a 6 kg portable fire extinguisher and a smothering blanket.  

    * Portable fire extinguisher 6 kg

      The efficiency rating of the fire extinguisher should be at least 27A 144BC. The extinguisher needs to be easy to retrieve and the location should be in close vicinity to the gas stove. A powder extinguisher can be substituted by a liquid extinguisher of at least 6 litres (efficiency rating at least 13A 144B) or with a carbon-dioxide extinguisher of at least 5 kg.  

    * Smothering blanket, size at 120cm x 180cm  

      A smothering blanket is needed if the camp unit uses a gas stove or equivalent.  

* The camp units need to bring the portable extinguisher and smothering blanket themselves.  

If you notice a fire, call the emergency number 112 and if possible, execute first-aid extinguishing. However, do not expose yourself to danger.  
 

####Using liquid gas (LPG)####  

* The camp units are allowed to bring a gas stove and liquid gas for i.e. brewing coffee. This equipment will be checked by the camp security in the beginning of the camp and they have to fulfil the requirements of the statute of liquid gas. The camp security will keep track of the locations and amount of equipment using liquid gas and the gas containers and checks that the first-aid extinguishing equipment is sufficient.  
* In a camp unit there can be a maximum of 25 kg of liquid gas at a time (i.e. 2 containers à 11 kg = the container attached to the cooker and an extra container). Excess containers must be stored at the camp gas storage.  
* According to the liquid gas regulations, the gas hose connected to the gas container cannot exceed 120 centimetres. Tee junctions without a stopper cannot be installed into the gas hose. If you want to install a junction to the gas hose, there has to be a stopper in every direction, and the overall length cannot exceed 120 centimetres.  
* The tightness of the gas hoses, connectors and burners must be checked using soap water from the container all the way to the burner. If you smell gas when using the gas container, the valve must be closed immediately. After closing the valve, the gas hose and the connectors have to be checked and the leak searched using soap water.  
* The gas containers must always be stored and used the right side up with the valve facing up. The gas container in use must be secured by tying it up, framing it or digging a pothole for the container; depth at least one third of the container's height. If the container tips, the gas flows in liquid form to the burner, and the flame in the burner grows abruptly and multiplies in size -> risk of fire and burn injuries is imminent.  
 

####Safety with liquid gas####  

**Pay attention to the following safety instructions when using gas stoves:**  

Larger gas stoves (for example under a paella pan):  

* Require a non-flammable surface so that even in case it falls the flames will not reach the flammable material or the ground.  
* Only 25 kilograms of gas can be stored close to the device, for example in a tent nearby. Other containers must be stored in the camp gas storage area.  
* All devices must be CE-marked  
* Usage allowed only in adult supervision  
* During a fire forest warning usage allowed in special cases only, with a permit from the camp fire brigade.  

Primus cookers:

* Usage allowed on non-flammable surface.  
* Usage allowed only in adult supervision.  

* Take notice of the regulations on first-aid extinguishing: the portable fire extinguisher and the smothering blanket.


**CHANGING A LIQUID GAS CONTAINER**

* When changing a liquid gas container the flame must be extinguished in the burner and the gas valves must be closed.

name: Communication during the camp
description:
####Information boards####  

Each subcamp has an information board where you will find a daily update on the current events in the form of the bulletin Päre and other necessary announcements. Please make it a habit of your camp unit to check out the information board daily!  

####Camp magazine Käry####  

The Roihu camp magazine Käry is published four times during the camp in Finnish, Swedish and English. Käry is available at the subcamp offices or you can read it at the cafes. There will not be enough copies for all the participants to keep one, so if you do not wish to take a copy home with you, please return it in a good condition for the next reader! Old Kärys are collected at the subcamp offices. An online version of Käry will also be available.  

Story suggestions for Käry can be sent as a text message to (number *comes here later*), via email to kary@roihu2015.fi or by handing in a tip to the mail box by the editorial office. The office can be found in Solmu.  

####Radio Roihu####   

Roihu's radio channel will broadcast from dusk till dawn and is heard through both FM and online. More information about the channel will be published on the Roihu website by the beginning of the camp.   

####Social media channels####   

Social media channels of Roihu will carry on posting during the camp. Usage of mobile phones and other internet devices is not forbidden, but we advise participants to focus on the programme and meal times and leave social media to their free time. Remember to respect others on social media channels and to show Roihu spirit!   

####Roihu App####  

The camp app includes camper instructions, which may be updated during the camp. Updates will be apparent for the users sometime between an hour and 24 hours, depending on for example the internet connection at the camp. Plans have been made for an event search where the participants may add an event of their own for others to find.  

####Communication in a State of an Emergency####    

You never know what is going to happen in a camping environment and sometimes unpleasant surprises occur. At such times it is very important that the campers and their leaders do not announce information about the emergency to the outside world – this includes social media channels, friends at home or anyone else outside the camp. The camp has a professional communications team which is prepared to make announcements in a state of an emergency. In case of a serious accident the entire management of the camp will ensure that the family of the person hurt will be notified, so the camp unit does not have to take care of that.  

In case there is an accident, emergency or other unexpected situation at the camp, you may notify all the people inquiring that the camp's communication team will make an announcement. **Please do not:**

* reveal names of the peoples in question to different medias or other outsiders.  
* share information that involves a police investigation; such information is only shared by the police.  
* announce any speculations or assumptions about what caused the events; expressions such as "perhaps", "maybe", and "possibly" are forbidden!  
* make assumptions about how the situation has been prepared for beforehand.

name: Kommunikation under lägret
description:
####Anslagstavlor####   

​Vid varje underlägerkansli finns en anslagstavla med aktualiteter. Dagligen hängs infobrevet Pärtan (Päre) upp. Pärtan informerar hela lägret om sådant som är aktuellt under dagen. Ta för vana att kolla in vad som meddelas på anslagstavlorna.   

####Lägertidningen Käry####   

Lägertidningen publiceras som en fysisk papperstidning fyra gånger under lägret. I tidningen kan du läsa roliga och informativa inlägg både på finska, svenska och engelska. Käry delas ut till underlägerkanslierna och den går även att läsa i lägrets caféer. Varje lägerdeltagare kommer inte att få ett eget exemplar av tidningen. Om du inte tänkte ta tidningen med dig hem, önskar vi att du lämnar kvar tidningen i gott skick åt följande läsare. Käry finns också att läsa elektroniskt.  

Du kan tipsa redaktionen om bra ämnen per sms (telefonnumret *kommer att meddelas senare*) eller per e-post kary@roihu2016.fi eller genom att lämna ett meddelande i redaktionens postlåda som du hittar vid redaktionens tillhåll vid Knutpunkten.   

####Roihuradion####   

​Roihus egen radio sänder program från morgon till kväll. Du kan lyssna på kanalen både via FM-frekvensen och via Roihus webbsidor. Noggrannare information om programtider och frekvenser publiceras på Roihus webbsidor före lägret.   

####Roihus somekanaler####   

Roihus somekanaler håller igång också under lägret. Det är inte förbjudet att använda elektroniska apparater och att vara uppkopplad men i programmet och vid måltiderna är det bra att koncentrera sig på lägerlivet runt omkring en och surfa i de sociala medierna istället under fritiden. Visst kommer du ihåg att respektera andra om du postar inlägg?  

####Roihu Appen####   

Lägrets egen applikation innehåller instruktioner för lägerdeltagaren. I planerna finns också en funktion för sökning av evenemang. Deltagarna kan själva lägga till evenemang som de önskar marknadsföra till andra deltagare.   

####Kommunikationen i undantagsfall####   

I lägerförhållanden händer det och sker det, också mindre trevliga saker. I sådana här fall är det ytterst viktigt att lägerdeltagarna (inte heller ledarna) självmant berättar utåt t.ex. i sociala medier, till hemmen, kompisarna eller andra utomstående vad som hänt. Lägret har ett kunnigt kommunikationsteam som har välgenomtänkta planer på hur kommunikationen sköts i undantagsfall. Vid allvarliga olyckor sköter lägerledningen om kontakten till de anhöriga. Det är alltså inte på lägerkårens ansvar.   
 
Om det sker en allvarlig olycka eller motsvarande som ger upphov till förfrågningar skall du alltid svara att lägrets kommunikationsteam svarar på frågor och sköter om kommunikationen utåt. **Berätta inte:**  ​  

* personers namn för medier eller utomstående.   
* saker som hör ihop med polisundersökningar; polisen informerar om dem.   
* antaganden och gissningar om vad som orsakat händelserna; orden "kanske", "möjligtvis", "troligtvis" är förbjudna!   
* antaganden och gissningar om på vilket sätt man förberett sig för situationen på förhand.

name: Hampaiden pesu​
description:
####Hampaiden pesu####    

Leirilippukunnissa hampaiden pesun jäteastiana käytetään ämpäriä, saavia tai sankoa, joka on helppo kuljettaa leirilippukunnista tyhjennettäväksi vessoihin. Hampaiden pesu voidaan suorittaa myös kätevästi vessakäynnin yhteydessä, jolloin vedet voi sylkeä suoraan bajamajaan tai pisuaariin.​​​ Huolto-organisaatio toimittaa 1 kpl kannellisiä ämpäreitä / leirilippukunta hampaidenpesuvesiä varten, mahdolliset lisä-ämpärit tai​ muut leirilippukunnan tarpeelliseksi katsomat astiat on tuotava mukana.

name: Suihkut
description:
####Suihkut####  

Leirin yleiset suihkut ja saunat on sijoitettu kahteen paikkaan, pohjoiseen päiväkodin tuntumaan ja etelään vesilaakson viereen.  

Suihkut ovat käytössä päivittäin 8:00 alkaen. Pohjoisen suihku suljetaan 30 minuuttia ennen hiljaisuutta. Etelän suihku suljetaan samaan aikaan *iltakahvilan* kanssa.  

Suihkujen yhteydessä olevat saunat ovat käytössä pääsääntöisesti suihkujen aukioloaikoina, poikkeuksena tietyt erityisvaraukset. Huomioithan saunaan aikoessasi, että ehdit myös peseytyä ennen suihkujen sulkemista.  

*Sujuvan ja kaikkien kannalta miellyttävämmän peseytymisen varmistamiseksi on syytä muistaa pari perusasiaa:*   

* Ympäristönsuojelullisista syistä suihkuilla saa käyttää vain biohajoavia pesuaineita  
* Suihkuja on rajallinen määrä, joten pyrithän suoriutumaan peseytymisestä mahdollisimman vikkelästi  
* Pukeutumistilaa on rajallisesti, joten älä tuo turhaa ylimääräistä tavaraa mukanasi suihkuille  
* Voimakkaasti hajustettujen pesuaineiden ja hygieniatuotteiden käyttö yhteisillä suihkuilla ei ole sallittua hajusteyliherkkyyksien vuoksi  
* Suihku- ja pukutiloja ei ole tarkoitettu hiusten värjäämiseen, vesisotaan, pyykkäämiseen...  
* Pidetään pesutilat muun leirin ohella yhdessä siistinä  

Pesutiimi päivystää aukioloaikoina suihkuilla ja auttaa mielellään erilaisissa pulmatilanteissa.

name: WC
description:
####Leirillä käytettävät WC:t####   

Leirillä on sijoitettuna bajamaja-tyyppisiä WC:itä useisiin eri sijainteihin ryppäiksi. Käytättehän lähimpänä sijaitsevaa, teille tarkoitettua WC:tä. Osaan ryppäistä on myös sijoitettu Inva-Bajamajoja. Vain niiden henkilöiden, joilla on jonkinlainen tarve inva-WC:seen, olisi suositeltavaa käyttää niitä. Osa kopeista on saatettu myös varata erilaisille toimijoille pääsääntöisesti hygieniasyistä, esim. keittiöhenkilökunnalle. Nämäkin WC:t on hyvä jättää oikealle kohderyhmälleen, jos ne sattuvat olemaan jostain syystä auki.  


####Paperin riittävyys ja siisteys####  

Huoltojen yhteydessä WC:isiin toimitetaan paperia muutaman kerran päivässä. Jotta paperi riittäisi kaikille tarvitsijoille, ethän käytä sitä mihinkään muuhun kuin alkuperäiseen tarkoitukseensa; jos jokainen leiriläinen käy esim. ottamassa yhden rullan omaan käyttöönsä, ei paperin määrää saada heti täydennettyä eikä se välttämättä riitä loppuleiriä varten. Paperin loppuessa on loppumisesta hyvä ilmoittaa eteenpäin esim. alaleiritoimistoon mainiten kopin tunniste, jolloin huolto saadaan kohdistettua oikeaan osoitteeseeen. Näin tulee myös toimia, mikäli säiliö on ääriään myöten täynnä tai koppi on muuten erittäin siivottomassa kunnossa.  

Bajamajoissa tarpeet suoritetaan istualtaan,ei seisten miesten osalta eikä kyykyssä kv. vieraiden osalta. Paperin laittaminen ei myöskään ole suotavaa suojaamaan istuinosaa. Tarvittaessa istuimen ​voi pyyhkiä puhtaaksi WC-paperilla. ​​  


####Jonotus####  

Ryppäille tulee jonoa, etenkin aamuisin. Otathan muut käyttäjät huomioon sekä seuraa jonotuspolitiikkaa.

name: Parempi lippukunta
description:

name: Tryggt tillsammans
description:
####Tryggt tillsammans####   

 
Tryggt tillsammans -kursen är obligatorisk för alla 18 år fyllda scoutledare och för gruppledare oberoende av ålder. Det rekommenderas att kursen genomförs snarast möjligt. Kursen skall vara genomförd för alla 18 år fyllda scoutledare och vuxna som deltar i Roihu 2016. Kursen genomförs i Moodle och även icke scouter kan genomföra kursen. Kursen är gjord för scouter så termerna är också scout-aktiga. För tillfället kan kursen göras på svenska och finska.  

 
[Mera information om programmet](http://verksamhet.scout.fi/utbildning/tryggt-tillsammans)
 
[Länk till Scout Moodle](http://moodle.partio.fi/)
 
[Länk till kursen för dem som inte är scouter](https://tymoodle.partio.fi)

 
####Tryggt tillsammans -Instruktioner på Roihu####  

Finlands Scouter vill för sin egen del säkerställa att barn och unga har det bra inom scoutverksamheten och detta gäller naturligtvis också Roihu. Scoutledarna, gruppledarna och övriga vuxna på lägret skall med sin egen handling säkerställa ett tryggt och trevligt läger för alla.   

Alla skall komma ihåg att bemöta varandra med respekt även då man är trött. Här är några **princuper för respektfullt bemötande:**
